Package server

Class ServerController

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
server.ServerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ServerController
extends java.lang.Thread
This class handles the logic of the in and out coming objects from the clients.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Carolin Nordstrom, Oscar Kareld, Chanon Borgstrom, Sofia Hallberg.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ServerController​(int port)
    Constructs all the buffers and servers and HashMaps that is needed.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerController

      public ServerController​(int port)
      Constructs all the buffers and servers and HashMaps that is needed.
      Parameters:
      port - the received port number.

  • Method Details

    • writeUsers

      public void writeUsers​(java.lang.String filename)
      Opens a stream and writes the user objects to the stream and then creates a file.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the created file.

    • readUsers

      public void readUsers​(java.lang.String filename)
      Reads a text file from the files folder and adds them to the contacts array. Then sets the contacts array to oldContactList array.
      Parameters:
      filename - the read filename.

    • checkLoginUser

      public User checkLoginUser​(User user)
      Checks whether the User who recently logged in is a new user or not.
      Parameters:
      user - the logged in User.
      Returns:
      an updated User.

    • sendActivity

      public void sendActivity​(java.lang.String username)
      Receives a username and gets a User-object from the HashMap. If the user's activity has been delayed a delayed activity is sent to the sendBuffer, else a new activity is sent to the client.
      Parameters:
      username - the received username.

    • createUserTimer

      public void createUserTimer​(User user)
      Creates a UserTimer-object and starts the timer and puts the object in a UserTimerHashMap.
      Parameters:
      user - the received User which the UserTimer is connected to.

    • removeUserTimer

      public void removeUserTimer​(java.lang.String username)
      Retrieves a UserTimer object from the UserTimerHashMap and stops the received Timer.
      Parameters:
      username - the key that the UserTimerHashMap uses.

    • logOutUser

      public void logOutUser​(java.lang.String username)
      Receives the socket with the username and closes it and removes the socket from the HashMap.
      Parameters:
      username -

    • setDelayedActivity

      public void setDelayedActivity​(Activity activity)
      Receives an activity object and gets a user with the help of the activity object and sets a user's delayed activity with the activity. Then gets the connected userTimer and set the delay to 5min and set the activeDelay to true and then starts the Timer.
      Parameters:
      activity - the received activity.

    • updateUserInterval

      public void updateUserInterval​(User user)
      receives a UserTimer object and update the UserTimer's User object and stops the timer and sets the currentTime with the recent currentTime and starts the timer.
      Parameters:
      user - the received User object.

    • run

      public void run()
      Receives a User object from the receive-Buffer and checks if it's a User or a Activity.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class java.lang.Thread
